entry.title: Send a11y focus event when selecting a recent app
entry.content:
Recent apps views are AppListItemViews, which have default focus

handling disabled, so the focus event is not sent from `View::Focus()`

when the view gets focused. Send the focus event to accessibility layer

from the recent apps' grid delegate `SetSelectedView()` instead, as it's

done for `AppsGridView`.



BUG=b:305229345



Change-Id: I50c2a2e87a4ee59d54efa13b7c03f98de42aaa3f

entry.title: Add feedback mechanism for Orca.
entry.content:
Orca editor needs to send feedback. We reuse the Chrome feedback

reporter logic to send reports to a specially designated product ID that

is locked down.



Add Mojo APIs so the frontend can preview the feedback (including its

metadata), as well as submit the feedback.



Modify the Chrome feedback code slightly so that only privacy-approved

metadata are sent along in the report.



Add tests to ensure that we only include privacy-approved metadata.



1-pager: http://docs/document/d/13kxS2mD2H8jEmKsTxKX-NOAfM6b5rTcmQ-xBeQhf020?resourcekey=0-ApQNLRa3wb3cnWHRhWMrvQ#heading=h.t5i1jjkqpa41



Internal CL: cl/575023611



Bug: b/301518187

entry.title: [remoting] Implement fractional coordinate injection.
entry.content:
This adds a new filter to the input pipeline, which converts any

fractional coordinates in each event to input-injection coordinates.

The calculation is based on the current VideoLayout, and the computed

coordinates are in the same units of measurement (DIPS/pixels) as the

VideoLayout.



The existing MouseInputFilter is responsible for tracking the current

input/output bounds used for scaling and clamping. It has been

modified to pass through unchanged any MouseEvents that have

fractional coordinates, because these are managed by the new filter.



Bug: b:227378399

Change-Id: I739bae8dff112993dd463262291b083f4343a095

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4956965

entry.title: LinkPreview: Implement preview activation baseline
entry.content:
This patch introduces a content public interface to activate

a preview page. The API tells the RenderViewHost to send an

IPC to relevant renderers, and each render runs the prerendering

activation algorithm and results in document.prerendering state

update, and running queued tasks, such as resolving promises,

releasing AudioContext, etc.

entry.title: WebUI: Don't hardcode common excluded WebUI URLs into bundle_js().
entry.content:
Instead pass such excludes as a parameter from optimize_webui() and

build_webui().



This is to accommodate a few cases that shouldn't exclude such files,

and where bundle_js() runs in a non traditional WebUI context.

Specifically it will be used to bundle load_time_data.js in



- components/security_interstitials/core/browser/resources/

- components/neterror/resources/



which in turn will allow to stop relying on the legacy

load_time_data_deprecated.js.



Bug: 1173575

entry.title: Validate supported ApiSets for Windows 10 10240
entry.content:
Modules on Windows can import functions either by specifying a

dll name (e.g. kernel32.dll) or by specifying an apiset[0]

(e.g. api-ms-win-core-synch-l1-2-0.dll). These apisets do not

exist as dlls but are resolved by the loader based on information

provided in the ApiSetSchema.dll's .apiset section which is shipped

as part of Windows.



ApiSets have a name (e.g. api-ms-win-core-synch) and (major, minor,

subversion) (e.g. 1, 2, 0) fields. An ApiSet is supported if the name

and (major, minor) versions are in ApiSetSchema.dll and the

subversion is less than or equal to the exported subversion.



Additional apisets can be specified in registry keys[0] but none are

provided on our specimen Windows 10 10240 system.



Dlls shipped with Chrome may import these apisets and we can avoid

shipping a dll with an unsupported import by validating that the

apiset was implemented on Chrome's oldest supported version of

Windows (10240).



This CL adds SupportedApiSet to delayloads_unittests and checks in

a list of exposed apisets parsed from ApiSetSchema.dll from a Windows

10 10240 image.



[0] https://www.geoffchappell.com/studies/windows/win32/apisetschema/index.htm

[1] "HKLM:System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\ApiSetSchemaExtensions"



Bug: 1483440

Change-Id: I57359c097f71aa15f83962c359153632485957c0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4967970

Commit-Queue: Alex Gough

Reviewed-by: Bruce Dawson

entry.title: Refactor to remove openxr_defs file
entry.content:
The openxr_defs file primarily existed as a way to add definitions for

extensions that were supported by devices but not yet in our roll of

openxr. This change makes two updates that render the file unnecessary:



First, it removes the extension names that now do exist in the checked-

in version of openxr and updates all references to that.



Second, At some point I expanded it to include interaction profile

paths as well. This change moves those paths into

openxr_interaction_profiles where they unfortunately have to be

included in the header due to the way that the test code wants to

consume them.

entry.title: Add extensions specified in --load-extension to telemetry reports
entry.content:
Chrome ignores the --load-extension command line switch for users opted

into Enhanced Safe Browsing (ESB). This behavior prevents the extension

telemetry service from collecting information about these extensions.



Add logic in extension telemetry service to collect information about

command-line extensions without actually installing them.

The information collected is the same as other offstore extensions,

i.e., the manifest.json file and hashes of other extension files.

entry.title: [Auto-disable Accessibility] Remove DCHECK that can be false and fix timer
entry.content:
This CL updates the auto-disable accessibility code to remove a DCHECK

that can sometimes be false, and to add a cancel timer call.



With this CL we remove a DCHECK that asserted that if accessibility was

re-enabled after having been disabled by the auto-disable accessibility

feature, then the AXMode must be something other than kNone. This is not

always the case since the accessibility engine will be re-enabled on the

first call from the framework, but the AXMode state is dependent on the

async call from AccessibilityState. If the AccessibilityState found a

discrepancy between the running and enabled services, there will be a

small time period when AXMode has not been fully set yet. For similar

reasons, we add a cancel timer call to account for when a user may

toggle the accessibility state in quick succession, and the system had

not reached agreement before the next change in accessibility state. To

be safe, whenever any service is enabled, we cancel any running auto-

disable accessibility timers (which in happy path would be none).



Change-Id: I94a7c3659367808daededcb76fd83fff524a2fbe

AX-Relnotes: N/A

Bug: 1430202, b/265493191

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4959117

Reviewed-by: David Tseng

Commit-Queue: Mark Schillaci

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1213845}

entry.title: Revert "Re-land "Enable keyboard-triggered tooltips in Views.""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 228ff9278b4f9b0c02a0009d0c50615b8856edd1.



Reason for revert: Somehow I made even mouse-triggered tooltips much more broken on Lacros.



Original change's description:

> Re-land "Enable keyboard-triggered tooltips in Views."

>

> This reverts commit f84138b85ae8ccdcf2d59ab4872929fb027c4a4f

> and relands commit 96ec1f1f2c76a7110bc7f20f474eeb49d10deb1f (whose

> commit message is below), but without the changes for Lacros.

>

> In other words, keyboard-triggered tooltips should work for

> Windows, Linux, and Ash-Chrome, but not Lacros-Chrome.

>

> Making Lacros-Chrome work will come in a follow-on CL.

>

> > Author: Dirk Pranke

> > Date: Mon Oct 16 21:27:18 2023 +0000

> >

> > Enable keyboard-triggered tooltips in Views.

> >

> > This adds support for keyboard-triggered tooltips to Views; with

> > this, whenever a View is focused (i.e., View::Focus is called),

> > we will now temporarily display a tooltip if the View has text

> > for one, much as if we had hovered over the view instead.

> >

entry.title: Temporarily make svenzheng an OWNER of cq usage and chromium gardeners
entry.content:
For the duration of crbug.com/1471166, some builders on the cq and on

the sheriff rotation will be renamed. For safety, this needs to be

done in a series of CLs. But so as not to lose coverage for an

extended period of time, the series of CLs needs to land in quick

succession.



However, some of these CLs touch files with limited OWNERShip. ie:

the cq-default.cfg file as well as the file that lists all bots on

the main gardening rotation.



So this makes sven an OWNER of those two files temporarily, to ease

the turnaround time for some of the CLs. This should be reverted

when the bug is complete.

entry.title: Refactor VCN risk-based authentication into CreditCardRiskBasedAuthenticator.
entry.content:
Why we make this change?

Virtual card authentication flow is risk-based, and lives in

CreditCardAccessManager, which is a generic credit card fetching and

handling class. Given risk-based authentication is a relatively

independent flow, it's better to be moved into that to make

CreditCardAccessManager cleaner and more focused. Recently,

CreditCardRiskBasedAuthenticator class was built for masked server card,

so we decided to merge the virtual card authentication flow into it.



What is changed by this CL?

Changes starts from the function call of CCAM.FetchVirtualCard: after

pop up the autofill progress dialog, the logic of preparing the unmask

request and the action to call payment clients to authenticate are moved

to CCRBA. The response of the unmask still gets passed back to CCAM and

handled there. Here we have a TODO: merge

OnVirtualCardRiskBasedAuthenticationResponseReceived and

OnRiskBasedAuthenticationResponseReceived together.

CreditCardAccessManagerCardMetadataTest is moved from CCAM_test to

CCRBA_test as it's technically belongs to risk-based authentication

flow, this is the code moving diff:

https://diff.googleplex.com/#key=BX1rP8MDcpSs



Bug: 1487282

Change-Id: Icf239079feeea6dba413eab9f60e9d46cb3d7364

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4919771

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

entry.title: [CompositeClipPathAnimations] Make composite CC anim tests use steps()
entry.content:
This change is part of an ongoing effort to increase test coverage to increase confidence in a potential change the the method of interpolation in clip paths.



Steps() is used here with careful timing to ensure the composited animation is created in a state just before its first step to ensure that the main thread has not rendered the animation in the expected state, and a screenshot captured just after. This approach helps in accurately testing the composited animation rendering with precise expected values.



Bug: 1447045

and relands commit 96ec1f1f2c76a7110bc7f20f474eeb49d10deb1f (whose

entry.title: [X11] Lazily parse events
entry.content:
The objective of this CL is to reduce binary size. Previously we had

a large ReadEvent function that called every event parser, even though

we don't need most events. This CL changes event parsing to happen

lazily when events are casted with event->As(). This means the

linker can remove any event parsers (and destructors) that are unused.

entry.title: Refactor Functions that GraphicsDelegateAndroid will use
entry.content:
A lot of the functionality that the GraphicsDelegateWin does is somewhat

unrelated to actually making graphics calls. As such, in the initial

pass of a GraphicsDelegateAndroid class, a lot of code was functionally

identitical. This makes a first pass at sorting out methods that can be

shared between the two implementations and pulling them into the base

class. We can easily walk these back if needed; but it may help to

simplify future code reviews.



There is one functional change here: GetTextureSize now returns a Size

rather than a RectF, and EnsureMemoryBuffer simply calls it rather than

being passed in a width/height. We also now simply store the last size

rather than the last width/height.



Bug: 1429376

entry.title: Support cross-tab navigation in PrefetchServingPageMetrics
entry.content:
This CL sets `serving_page_metrics_.same_tab_as_prefetching_tab`

based on initiator WebContents comparison.



`same_tab_as_prefetching_tab` will be set to false in

prefetch-in-new-tab cases (crbug.com/1432886), but this CL

itself isn't expected to affect the metrics, because

`PrefetchDocumentManager::DidStartNavigation()` isn't called

and thus `PrefetchServingPageMetricsContainer` isn't created

for prefetch-in-new-tab navigations in ordinal cases until

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4953788.

entry.title: infra: Remove GPU-rotation bots from the mega CQ
entry.content:
Some GPU trybots share the same limited builder pool. And when all

trybots are triggered at the same time, they compete for the same bots.

And eventually expire, eg:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/gpu-fyi-try-win10-nvidia-rel-32/272/overview

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/gpu-fyi-try-win10-nvidia-exp-64/155/overview



Until the mega CQ can increase expirations for builds, we'll just

remove all GPU-sheriff'ed bots from the mega CQ.



Bug: 1227778

entry.title: [Extensions] DCHECK if WorkerIdSet contains >1 worker per extension
entry.content:
In theory, there should only be one registered "extension service

worker" per extension (that is, the service worker associated with a

top-level scope for an extension; this worker has access to extension

APIs and is associated with extension events).



We have a few reports that in exceptionally rare cases, this assumption

can be violated. Add a DCHECK to gather more data here.

entry.title: [3PCD] Improve eligibility metrics
entry.content:
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4891456 added

a metric to report the reason why a client is eligible or not. However,

the implementation was fragile as its accuracy to report the

set/computed client eligibility relied on the caller behavior.



That assumption was broken when this metric was added:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4911717



This CL does two things:

1. It moves and renames the existing metric to the caller to ensure its

accuracy.

2. It adds a second metric that reports a profile computed eligibility.

This will allow monitoring that we do not have bias when setting the

client eligibility.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[PrivacySandbox.CookieDeprecationFacilitatedTesting.ProfileEligibility]=Replaced by PrivacySandbox.CookieDeprecationFacilitatedTesting.ReasonForEligibilityStoredInPrefs).

entry.title: ChromeOS Ash: send kerberos environment vars to restarted net service
entry.content:
In Ash, the kerberos environment variables (KRB5CCNAME and KRB5_CONFIG)

were only sent to the network service (which runs gssapi libraries) the

first time it starts. If the network service crashes or restarts, the

env vars would not be sent to the new network service.



Lacros correctly sends the env vars as initialization params to each new

network service, and uses the same values as Ash. Reuse the Lacros code

for Ash.



Change-Id: Ib26f3ae29360361f661de65ec7101b947b98a26b

Bug: 1494567

entry.title: [gbb-cct] Handle back presses.
entry.content:
Because a separate BottomSheetController is created for Page Insights, we do not automatically get registered as a back press handler, and so we must register ourselves separately. We have to do this under the old regime (in ChromeActivity) and under the new regime (with BackPressManager). I've made sure to test this in both regimes (by flipping "back gesture refactor" flag on and off).



I don't think we should be exposing the existence of Page Insights outside of custom tabs code, so I've filed b/307046796 to track coming up with a better solution.

entry.title: Avoid type-punning in TestElfImageBuilder
entry.content:
TestElfImageBuilder casts the output buffer into a struct and writes

into it. Not only does this violate strict aliasing (which we disable),

but it runs afoul of pointer alignment requirements.



Instead, use the existing AppendHdr helper, which memcpys the struct

into the buffer. Ideally we'd also be bounds-checked, but that's a

larger rewrite.

entry.title: gpu: Only import a single plane into Vulkan for Y/UV buffers
entry.content:
For workloads that use the WebGraphicsContext3DVideoFramePool (e.g.

visual effects on Meet), Chrome will create separate SharedImages

for the Y and UV planes. Both planes are stored in the same buffer

allocation, with the UV plane with an offset immediately after the

Y plane. Chrome passes the metadata for both planes (via the GMB)

when creating either the Y or the UV SharedImage, but varies the

gfx::BufferPlane [1].



When Chrome later wants to composite this content, it will pull a

SkiaGanesh SharedImage representation from the OzoneImageBacking

(assuming CrOS). If Chrome is using the Skia Vulkan backend, this

will require importing the underlying buffer into Vulkan via the

dmabuf extensions which is encapsulated in VulkanImage [2].



VulkanImage then sets up the plane layout used for Vulkan import

from the GMB's list of planes [3]. As mentioned earlier, however,

this list of planes includes both the Y and UV planes even though

the SharedImage refers to a single plane. For example, when

importing the UV plane, the GMB's list of planes could be

[{ offset: 0 }, { offset: 921600 }], but the VkFormat of image is

VK_FORMAT_R8G8_UNORM. Specifying two planes for import on a non-

planar VkFormat seems like undefined behavior, but in practice, I've

found that it imports the first plane in the list (which corresponds

to the Y plane) as the UV plane. This results in Chrome using the Y

plane for both the Y and UV planes which leads to the artifacting

seen in the bug.



This CL works around this issue by selectively choosing a single

plane when importing these legacy multiplanar SharedImages into

Vulkan.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/video/renderable_gpu_memory_buffer_video_frame_pool.cc;l=222;drc=f5bdc89c7395ed24f1b8d196a3bdd6232d5bf771

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:gpu/command_buffer/service/shared_image/ozone_image_backing.cc;l=225;drc=cce9492faf8ca9996ddb08f67db5a5008c4850c1

[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:gpu/vulkan/vulkan_image_linux.cc;l=68;drc=7e2bf5a68186120ed918fd67f1497777cb60b4de

entry.title: Avoid unnecessary thread hop in MultiBufferDataSourceProviderImpl
entry.content:
MultiBufferDataSourceFactory::CreateDataSource already runs on the same

thread as MBDSPI::ReadFromUrl and MBDSF::OnUrlData, so the thread hop is

unnecessary.



This solves a race condition present between the teardown of

UrlIndex and HlsDataSourceProviderImpl:



Main Thread | Media Thread

-------------------------------------------------|----------------------

HLSDataSourceProviderImpl::ReadFromUrl |

| |

v |

WebMediaPlayerImpl::GetUrlData |

|

|

HTMLMediaElement::~HTMLMediaElement |

| | |

| v |

| WebMediaPlayerImpl::~WebMediaPlayerImpl |

| |> DestructionHelper

v |

UrlIndex::~UrlIndex |

|

|

v |

HlsDataSourceProviderImpl::OnDataSourceReady |

| ... through many function hops |

v |

ResourceMultiBufferDataProvider::Start |

*deref `url_index_`, freed above |

|

DemuxerManager::~DemuxerManager <|

| ... through a few destructors |

v |

HlsDataSourceProviderImpl::~HlsDataSourceProviderImpl



R=dalecurtis

entry.title: Allow sources to set trigger_data_matching field
entry.content:
https://github.com/WICG/attribution-reporting-api/pull/1064



This is gated at parsing time by a new feature that is disabled by

default.



Note that we do not need a DB migration because the default behavior,

modulus, is retained for existing sources that lack the new field.



We expose the field in the Attribution Internals UI and the

experimental DevTools protocol event for source registrations.



We use a wrapper type in both C++ and Mojo because that encapsulation

will be necessary when the fields from

https://github.com/WICG/attribution-reporting-api/pull/1074 are added

in a followup change.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Conversions.CreateReportStatus8]=Replaced by Conversions.CreateReportStatus9

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Conversions.SentVerboseDebugReportType3]=Replaced by Conversions.SentVerboseDebugReportType4

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Conversions.SourceRegistrationError5]=Replaced by Conversions.SourceRegistrationError6

entry.title: [FedCM] Look up the FrameTreeNode in webid_utils
entry.content:
This way, the callback can distinguish between an invalid frame tree

ID and the lookup failing. This is important because in the former

case it is safe to process the header (initial load in a tab), but

in the latter case we can't safely proceed because we can't do the

same-origin check.



This also fixes a crash for the latter case (the lookup of the FTN

returned a null pointer).

entry.title: Add support for saved states in Compose dialog
entry.content:
When the user updates the state of the dialog (eg. typing an input), the app saves the state so that when the dialog is visited again, the dialog

returns to the saved state.



- Update validation to happen on `input_` change, not on textarea input

as the state can override the textarea's value without the user ever

interacting with the textarea.

- Update `result_` to `response_` to better match state's data.



(The WebuiState object will contain other properties later.)



not separately tested as they are mocked in tests.



Low-Coverage-Reason: COVERAGE_UNDERREPORTED. Proxies are typically

entry.title: Change text elider test to use a more common domain name
entry.content:
This test checks whether a spoofy looking domain is properly elided.

The spoof checks rely on a domain list and an update to the list breaks

the test because aaa.com is no longer in the list. This CL changes

the domain with a more popular one.



A better fix would be to use LookalikeTestHelper and pick a domain

from test domains list, but I'm punting that for now as this is the only

test failure in this suite.

entry.title: aria-details should set DescribedBy UIA property
entry.content:
According to https://github.com/w3c/core-aam/pull/205, aria-details

should map to the DescribedBy UIA property. Currently, only

aria-describedby maps to that property. This change maps aria-details to

DescribedBy and removes the mapping of aria-describedby to DescribedBy.



Fixed: 1492553

AX-Relnotes: aria-details will be exposed by DesribedBy for UIA users

entry.title: [Hub] Re-add startHiding tabId logic
entry.content:
This logic was originally planned for [1] but was removed after it

caused some confusion.



However, on further investigation, onTabSelecting is used as an observer

to sometimes defer tab selection until after a layout transition has

finished [2] or ensure a layout switch is triggered [3]. In the

case of Hub I don't believe this behavior is relevant. However, we

should match the behavior in TabSwitcherLayout until this logic can

possibly be refactored away and we can confirm [3] is not used.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4956814



[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/compositor/layouts/Layout.java;drc=8efd8d02fc55e5feafb62178799609ef1371ee90;l=446



[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/features/tab_ui/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/tasks/tab_management/TabSwitcherLayout.java;drc=99470270374b498a08587d265148e08aa7ac7539;l=200



Bug: 1487209, 1495121

entry.title: [window-splitting] Add UMA metrics for Window Splitting feature.
entry.content:
This change adds 6 new UMA histograms:

* Enum of whether a drag results in window splitting.

* Enum of which region window splitting happens.

* Duration of dragging when a window is split vs not.

* Number of times preview is shown when a window is split or not.



Tests are also added to assert the histograms.



Minor refactor:

* Renamed SplitPosition to SplitRegion for semantic precision.



Bug: b:293614784

entry.title: Moving mremap(), sysinfo(), and clock_getres() behind a feature flag.
entry.content:
This change adds a feature flag that, when enabled, means the above

syscalls will be blocked by the AndroidBaselinePolicy. These syscalls

are only needed by the renderer, and Android will use the

RendererProcessPolicy to allow these calls.



Bug: 739879

entry.title: Improve power model for fullscreen overlays
entry.content:
We should always prioritize fullscreen overlays. This was changed when

we moved to a non bucketed hysteresis tracker. This change should make

sure that fullscreen overlays are sorted higher in power gained.

entry.title: Revert "Remove handling of esoteric run loop modes"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8a171b26609f119f63b5d68f88c0678a08f208a9.



Reason for revert: broke UserNotesInteractiveTest.TriggerNotesSidePanelFromTabContextMenu



Original change's description:

> Remove handling of esoteric run loop modes

>

> https://crrev.com/c/647836 was committed to improve Chromium's

> performance while native menus were fading out.

>

> Re "NSUnhighlightMenuRunLoopMode", code inspection seems to indicate

> that its use is restricted to apps linked against 10.10 SDKs and

> earlier, which matches experimentation.

>

> Re "com.apple.hitoolbox.windows.windowfadingmode", this is not present

> on macOS 14 or later, and even in previous releases of macOS it does

> not spin for long.

>

> And finally, most animations happen in the GPU process anyway (try

> stopping the browser process in a debugger and watch the animations

> continue; it's wild!), so it's not worth the price of keeping this

> complicated code.

>

> This effectively reverts https://crrev.com/c/647836 and

> https://crrev.com/c/1006238, re-implementing the latter using AppKit

> API rather than fiddling with run loop modes, which turns out to give

> a better UI experience.

>

> Fixed: 1451674

> Change-Id: Ic1429d644d40a5373a36fb67898a3c8733c07765
